Maharshi Gor | First Year Ph.D. CS Student University of Maryland

Hi! I am a first year CS PhD student at Univeristy of Maryland, College Park, currently working with Jordan Boyd-Graber. I am primarily insterested in Natural Language Understanding and Representation. Particularly in Question Answering, Semi-semantic structure understanding, Model Robustness and Interpretability. I am also very excited about learning and applying Visually grounded contexts for Language Understanding tasks.

In past, I have worked in Computer vision and Machine Learning space dealing with problems like: Human motion sequence modeling, Generative and Representation Learning and Adversarial Machine Learning. <!– Gradfolio is a responsive, dark-mode ready Jekyll theme designed keeping academia in mind. The easiest way to install the theme is to fork it using GitHub. Check the README file for instructions.

If you want to use this space to write your biography here, edit the index.md file. You can put a picture in, too. Rename your picture to profile.png and put it in the assets/images/ folder.

The social-icons footer can be used to link profiles from GitHub, OrcID and ReasearchGate aprart form the usual Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook. You can add your user ID in the _config.yml file to link your accounts. –>

NEWS FLASH NEWS Flash

  • Our work Toward Deconfounding the Influence of Entity Demographics for Question Answering Accuracy is accepted at EMNLP 2021.

  • Our work MATE: Multi-view Attention for Table Transformer Efficiency is accepted at EMNLP 2021 for oral presentation.

  • Reviewing for ICLR 2021
